page.title: 14THE TRENT-MERSEY CANAL
page.content: IN THE 1800 THE BARGES THAT WENT DOWN THE CANAL,THAT CARIED GOODS SUCH AS BEER,SILK,CLOTHES,FOOD,ETC,WERE PULLED BY HORSES.IT WAS A VERY SLOW PROGRESS. THE TRENT AND MERSEY IS AN EXTREEMLY LONG CANAL.IT STARTS JUST OUTSIDE LONG EATON IT RUNS UP AND OVER THE RIVER DOVE THROUGH BURTON AND THEN MAKES A STOP. MOST CANALS AROUND HAVE BEEN MAN MADE BUY FERMS IN THE 1700.TO GET TRANSPORT OF GOODS FROM ONE PLACE ANOTHER.YOU COULD NOT LIVE IN A BARGE ON THE CANAL UNTIL THE LATE 1800 BECAUSE THEY WERE ALL OPEN TOP BOATS THE BARGES TOOK ALONG TIME GETTING THROUGH THE LOCKS BECAUSE OF HOW SLOW IT GOES FROM THE HIGH LEVEL OF THE CANAL TO THE LOW LEVEL.KATHERN THE GREAT USED THE CANALS FOR TAKING BEER TO RUSSIA.
